edu.cnu.cs.gooey
Class Gooey

java.lang.Object
  edu.cnu.cs.gooey.Gooey

public class Gooey
extends java.lang.Object

Gooey is a test library with static methods for capturing windows and retrieving their components.

Methods in this class are designed to be called in functional JUnit tests. There are methods to capture displayed windows, and methods to query their components. Once a window is captured, methods can retrieve any component by type, by name, and (in the case of buttons, menus, tabs and labels) by text.

Author:
robertoflores
See Also:
interface to access a captured window.

getMenu

public static <T extends javax.swing.JMenuItem> T getMenu(javax.swing.JMenuBar menubar,
                                                          java.lang.String text,
                                                          GooeyFlag... flags)
Given a menu bar it returns the menu associated with the given text. Text may represent the label displayed or the programmatic name of the menu. To look for a menu by displayed label (default setting) use the GooeyFlag.Menu.BY_TEXT option. To look for a menu by name, use the GooeyFlag.Menu.BY_NAME option. If both were present BY_TEXT takes precedence over BY_NAME. Menu searches can be made throughout the menu structure (nested search) or under the provided menu (flat search). Nested search is the default setting. To perform a nested search use the GooeyFlag.Menu.NESTED. To perform a flat search use the GooeyFlag.Menu.FLAT. If both were present NESTED takes precedence over FLAT.

Parameters:
menubar - menu bar holding the menu.
text - text of the menu sought.
flags - optional flags for text search (by label, by name) and level search (nested, flat)
Returns:
menu found.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if no menu with the given text is found.

getMenu

public static <T extends javax.swing.JMenuItem> T getMenu(javax.swing.JMenu submenu,
                                                          java.lang.String text,
                                                          GooeyFlag... flags)
Given a sub-menu it returns the menu associated with the given text. Text may represent the label displayed or the programmatic name of the menu. To look for a menu by displayed label (default setting) use the GooeyFlag.Menu.BY_TEXT option. To look for a menu by name, use the GooeyFlag.Menu.BY_NAME option. If both were present BY_TEXT takes precedence over BY_NAME. Menu searches can be made throughout the menu structure (nested search) or under the provided menu (flat search). Nested search is the default setting. To perform a nested search use the GooeyFlag.Menu.NESTED. To perform a flat search use the GooeyFlag.Menu.FLAT. If both were present NESTED takes precedence over FLAT.

Parameters:
submenu - sub-menu holding the menu.
text - text of the menu sought.
flags - (optional) flags for text search (by label, by name) and level search (nested, flat)
Returns:
menu found.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if no menu with the given text is found.

getMenus

public static java.util.List<javax.swing.JMenu> getMenus(javax.swing.JMenuBar menubar)
Returns a list with top-level sub-menus in the menu bar. Nested sub-menus are not traversed.

Parameters:
menubar - menu bar to evaluate.
Returns:
list of sub-menus in the menu bar.

getMenus

public static java.util.List<javax.swing.JMenuItem> getMenus(javax.swing.JMenu submenu)
Returns a list with all menu options in the sub-menu provided. Nested sub-menus are not traversed.

Parameters:
submenu - sub-menu to evaluate.
Returns:
list of menu options in the sub-menu.

getComponent

public static <T extends java.awt.Component> T getComponent(java.awt.Container container,
                                                            java.lang.Class<T> swing)
Returns the first component of a class found in a container. Nested components are searched depth first.

Parameters:
container - container to evaluate.
swing - class of component sought.
Returns:
component found.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if no component of the given class is found.

getComponent

public static <T extends java.awt.Component> T getComponent(java.awt.Container container,
                                                            java.lang.Class<T> swing,
                                                            java.lang.String name,
                                                            GooeyFlag... flags)
Returns the first component of a class found in a container. If a name is provided (i.e., it's not null) then the component found will match both the class and name sought.

Parameters:
container - container to evaluate.
swing - class of component sought.
name - name of the component sought. It's not used if null.
flags - (optional) flags for level search (nested, flat)
Returns:
component found.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if no component with the given class and name is found.

Returns all components of a given class found in a container.

Parameters:
container - container to evaluate.
swing - class of components sought.
Returns:
list of components found.

getComponents

public static <T extends java.awt.Component> java.util.List<T> getComponents(java.awt.Container container,
                                                                             GooeyCriteria criteria)
Returns all components in a container that match the given criteria.

Parameters:
container - container to evaluate.
criteria - criteria indicating an accepting component.
Returns:
list of components found.

capture

public static <T extends GooeyWindow<U>,U extends java.awt.Window> void capture(T doRun)
Invokes a custom method displaying a window, waits for the window to display (within a timeout period) and invokes a method where testing can be performed. The parameter doRun is an instance of GooeyWindow with 2 abstract methods: invoke (overridden with the code to display a window) and handle (overridden with the code to test the window displayed). If no window is detected within a waiting period the method throws an AssertionError.

Parameters:
doRun - interface to display and handle the test of a window.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if no window is displayed.

capture

public static <T extends GooeyWindow<U>,U extends java.awt.Window> void capture(java.lang.String message,
                                                                                T doRun)
Invokes a custom method displaying a window, waits for the window to display (within a timeout period) and invokes a method where testing can be performed. The parameter doRun is an instance of GooeyWindow with 2 abstract methods: invoke (overridden with the code to display a window) and handle (overridden with the code to test the window displayed). If no window is detected within a waiting period the method throws an AssertionError.

Parameters:
doRun - interface to display and handle the test of a window.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if no window is displayed.
